title: Small Android phones could be huge — but only if they’re cheap
content:
For the last few days, a new website called SmallAndroidPhone has been doing the rounds on Hacker News and Reddit. The site was created by Pebble founder Eric Migicovsky, and he’s making a pitch for a great small Android phone. It’s a story we’ve heard countless times before: many people love small and powerful Android phones, but there aren’t many options. Apple released a tiny iPhone two years ago, but multiple reports suggest there won’t be an iPhone 14 mini. So what does Migicovsky want? Easy: a no-compromise Android phone with a less than 6-inch screen. Ideally, it should be…

description: It'll be great to have a compact Android phone with no-compromise specs. But the small smartphone market needs a sleeper hit.
